What is the value of \( f^{-1}(6) \)?
What does \( f^{-1}\) of the value from step 1 give us?
Step-by-step breakdown:
We know that \( f(2) = 6 \). Therefore, \( f^{-1}(6) = 2 \) because functions and their inverses undo each other.
Now we need \( f^{-1}(2) \). Since \( f(1) = 2 \), \( f^{-1}(2) = 1 \) as previously established using the nature of function inverses.
